name: Wulver (Final)
description:
‘Wulver is a game about a friendly anthropomorphic wolf who lives in a cave and helps the people of Scotland with their mythical creature problems. A 2D, semi-top-down, role-playing adventure game with stylized, hand drawn graphics, and a narrative that helps teach players about Scottish folklore and myths.’

Instructions: 

WASD = movement.

SPACE = interact with characters, fishing, eat berries.

LEFT-CLICK - attack.

Only take on one of the two quests at a time before accepting the other!

Design pillars: Educational, Fun, Cute, Casual

Target audience: All ages who want to learn about Scottish mythology and Gaelic. Casual roleplay gamers. Suitable for all audiences; cartoon combat.

Credit:

Music - MaSìm by Eabhal (edited) - thank you to The Bothy Society for giving us access to wonderful songs!

UI assets - Unity free-use assets.

Future goals:

- A Scot-Gaelic version of the game can be accessed in the Settings, however we would like to - complete and polish this version.

- Addition of more Gaelic words in the English version for beginners to pick up!

- Concepts for other quests around the full island exist - such as a transport mission with the White Cow of Lewis and interactions with the Bean-Nighe.

- In-depth character dialogue/information to convey more of the myths portrayed. 

- Further graphic work to add more character sprite animation and stylized environment. (water, grass) - More feedback mechanics to the player, such as visual/audio ques of enemies taking damage from Wulver’s attack.

The crew:

Game design - John Venters

Programming - Christina Moir

Art/Animation - Ren Hurley, Karolina Myszkowska

Created for The Kilter Otter Game Jam, 2021.
